Articles.Content:
I\'ve decided to start a naval series on the Exchange, and so today I have the first in the series, the AVN - Asteron!

**Radion Naval Centers**

Originally debuted on the Roleplay Forum, this little number can do quite the sorty, being able to glide into the water from land. She boasts a thin width, allowing the ship to cut through the water easily and with grace, never bouncing and splashing as other water models do. She\'s got enough fuel to run around 10-20 Kilometers, depending on the travel path, and boasts 4 turbine engines, basically jet engines on a boat, capable of putting a total amount of 400 units of thrust on the water. All of this culminates into an average cruise speed of 5.5 m/s, although the maximum is 6.3 m/s. Certainly not the fastest, but definitely able to defend your turf from another ship, should the need arise. In addition, the ship can be outfitted with railguns to increase the power of this vessel.

Now for some images -

Work, Images. Work!

Edit: Also, spoilers only work if they've got an =\* (replace the \* with the context of the spoiler) at the end of where it says 'spoiler'.
